column5: Hi GuysI'm new to this site and planning to go to canada next week to do some walleye fishing. Planning to go north of ranger lake and I am just wondering have the walleyes finished up spawning? I am told that this lake is a very deep cold lake. should I be fishing more of the shallow water/reefs? First time on this lake so I don't really know where to start, throwing jigs/minnows, trolling rapalas, tossing small spinners? Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thanks
Ranger Lake North Of Sault ont ????No walleye in this lake only lake trout
Wow, now that's not good news.
A very deep, cold lake would be my very last choice of lakes to fish for walleyes. Especially early in the year. Hope things work out for you.

make a quick drive down to the Windsor area and (Colchester) and fish here. we have TONS of walleye's just waiting for you. lake erie is unreal and the spawn is pretty much over now...plus you can get your limit of perch in no time, and take all the silver bass and white perch you can handle. enjoy!
